text: it's 9:00 in the morning and I'm out for

life howard jackets are one idea they
add an extra battery cycle to your phone
as long as you keep charged but it will
add some girth to your otherwise spelt
sidekick so if you're in need of a dire
fix then maybe a solar battery is the
way to go not just a personal one either
the park bench itself is set for a
high-tech solar makeover the sofa is a

in public places great here in
California not so great in other Sun
starved locales other solutions abound
some quite outlandish like this just

polymer battery but I'm looking for a
more ubiquitous answer and there are a

coffee chain
in a scheme just launched across the Bay
Area 200 Starbucks are hoping to become

giving you a quick and free fix while
you're coughing your coffee you find

you typically have your phone on the

the device won't charge tablets and you

same way you do it anywhere mobile e
which is you get down on your hands and

we just thought there's a better there's

reckons he's just about to launch a far

doesn't tether you to a corporate coffee

simply borrow a doublet from the

app they won't charge a handset until
you've handed over your credit card
paying $3 for a one-off charge or 33
years subscription best of all you can
walk away with it - the idea being you
can return it to any doublet venue
within five days or you get stung $50
for the cost of the doublet itself which
then works normally as a regular battery
nobody likes carrying around an external
battery and I can guarantee you nobody
likes remembering to keep those things
charged so for the most part if we can
get rid of that whole batteries anxiety
issue I think we'll be in good shape
there's no installation costs for venues
who also take a cut of revenue but will

the biggest competition to a company
like Dobler comes from the idea that
people will actually be willing to lend

in yourself in the wall you know there
are lots of bars and restaurants where
today they'll lend you a charger so not
